title: BBC Local Live: Essex on Wednesday, 6 July 2016 - BBC News
summary: ron king trial continues at chelmsford crown court .
airport police stop passenger with gun-style phone case .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: thanks for joining us on today 's essex live page .
here 's a flavour of the stories we 've been covering :
join us again at 08:00 tomorrow morning for thursday 's news , sport , weather and more .

documents.title: photo : the seagull eyeing up the beach lovers
text: we just had to share this image sent in to us by alan conran .
`` took this of a seagull surveying the beach goers below near to clacton pier , '' says alan .
as much as anything else , it 's just nice to see a blue sky , the seaside and no rain .

documents.title: weather : dry night ahead , cloudy start tomorrow
text: time for a look at the weather - this evening should stay dry with spells of hazy sunshine .
overnight it 's going to be dry with clear intervals but also lots of cloud .
lows of 13c , 55f .
tomorrow should be a mainly dry day but it 'll be cloudy , too , with the chance of some patchy drizzle later and highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
check the latest forecast for where you live with bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: what twitter has to say about that gun-style phone case
text: people have reacted with surprise that anybody would go into an airport with a phone case shaped like a gun handle .
essex police released images of the case earlier after the man walked into stansted airport .
on twitter philip padley said : `` some people have no common sense . ''
david preston meanwhile tweeted : `` there are apps for many things , but not one for stupidity . ''
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: colchester sign forest green 's guthrie
text: in sport and league two side colchester united sign forward kurtis guthrie from forest green rovers for an undisclosed fee .
meanwhile , u 's defenders tom eastman , 24 , and jamie harney , 20 , have signed new one-year contracts .

documents.title: rita king care home shooting : 'i asked her if she 'd had enough and she said yes '
text: chelmsford crown court has heard about ronald king 's relationship with his wife rita from interviews he gave to police .
the pair would have been married for 50 years this september , he told officers , and he visited her at de la mer house , a care home , `` once or twice a week '' .
`` she used to wait for me to have her breakfast - she said it used to brighten her day , '' mr king said .
but mrs king started crying when her husband told her he could n't cope with her coming home .
`` i asked her if she 'd had enough and she said yes , '' mr king told police .
when asked if mrs king knew he was planning on taking her life , mr king replied : `` she thought that we were going back home . ''
the trial continues .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: rita king 'would hardly recognise ' husband
text: during an interview with det con claire jennings from essex police , ronald king said his wife 's dementia had worsened in the months leading to her death .
he claimed her health went downhill after her walking frame was taken away and she was given a wheelchair .
`` sometimes she was alright and another day i 'd go [ to de la mer home ] and she 'd hardly recognise me , '' he said .
chelmsford crown court was played a video of mr king 's interview with police .
he denies murder .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: ronald king trial : 'he wanted to something up '
text: a taxi driver has told how a pensioner accused of murdering his wife asked him to take him home briefly so he could `` something up '' .
edward prevost told chelmsford crown court ronald king , 87 , was one of his regular fares who he saw sometimes twice a week .
he waited 10 minutes outside mr king 's home in walton .
it is understood he had gone to collect a world war two revolver .
he said : `` i do n't recall him saying much on journey back .
on collecting him he said he felt woozy .
`` when i got back to the office i was told the news that ron had shot his wife .
`` i was quite surprised to be honest - i never would have expected him to do anything like that . ''
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: 'i did it , i killed my wife , ' court hears
text: a senior care worker has told a jury she heard ronald king say `` i did it , i killed my wife '' after shooting her .
cecelia cole then showed chelmsford crown court how mr king held the weapon , a 1934 enfield revolver , up to his head .
but mr king , she said , held the gun with shaking arms and declared : `` i ca n't do it '' .
mrs cole ran to the lounge to find mr king 's wife of 50 years rita .
when she entered the room , the court was told it smelled like a `` fire cracker had gone off '' .
the trial continues .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: 'we are a forgiving family ' says cousin of stansted estate agent
text: the cousin of an essex estate agent who lost both of his legs after a hit-and-run in newmarket have urged the driver of the car to come forward .
friends and family are rallying round shaun whiter , who works in stansted and who stopped to help a friend change a tyre on friday .
a car crashed into him and his friend joey abbs , but then drove off - leaving shaun with injuries that were so severe he had to have both legs amputated .
his cousin charlotte o'brien said : `` shaun was left for dead .
the doctors have told us they ca n't believe he 's alive .
`` he just ca n't get his head around the fact that he was left , but we are a forgiving family .
`` we totally understand that in some circumstances you may panic and drive away , but just to make things a little bit easier for shaun 's recovery , we 'd like the person to come forward . ''
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: bopara disciplined over 'serious dissent '
text: the essex one-day captain ravi bopara has been disciplined by the england and wales cricket board for showing 'serious dissent ' in a t20 blast game against hampshire last month .
he could face a suspension for any similar incidents in the future .
author: Ben Fryer
BBC Essex sport

documents.title: airport police stop passenger with gun-style phone case
text: essex police have released images of a phone case spotted in the back pocket of a passenger which caused him to be stopped earlier at stansted airport .
police say the person risks being charged either with a public order offence or of carrying an imitation firearm in a public space .
we hope to have more details on the incident shortly .
this is what was in the back pocket an # iphone case .
someone decided to put themselves in such a situation today
phone in phablet size ?
no problem , case has complete grip , can hold in one hand , easy to keep and remove from pocket .
nice idea !
@ twitterid
why do n't you guys lighten up its a phone case .
find something better to do .
or is ur town that boring .
pathetic
someone seems to be quite stupid
@ twitterid bldy stupid to own this and just as bldy stupid and irresponsible to make this sort of case
jail them for 3 months for being stupid
wow that is a stupid phone case !
they should n't make those imo !
that can be the most stupid thing you can buy ever
@ essexpolicestn i bet this guy was flying to malta @ twitterid @ twitterid
just when you think you have seen it all , its not like gun crime is absent from essex !
i 'm speechless
what you guys need to do then is go after the manufacturer too .
asshole .
give him a good fine .
the price of an iphone
crazy !
you were quoted by @ twitterid

documents.title: iraq and the east of england : in numbers
text: iraq and the east of england : in numbers
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: iraq war : how our mps voted in 2003
text: it was 13 years ago , in march 2003 , that mps were asked to vote on the government motion authorising `` all means necessary '' for disarming saddam hussein .
there was a rebel motion in parliament opposing military action .
six officers from the royal military police , based in colchester , died in the conflict that followed .
here 's how our mps at the time voted :
for military action :
against military action :
live coverage on the chilcot report

documents.title: iraq war : two sides 13 years on
text: former colchester mp sir bob russell voted against the war .
he said the chilcot report was a `` vindication '' of the liberal democrats who unanimously voted against the invasion of iraq .
`` all options had not been exhausted , '' he said .
`` it became quite clear that tony blair wanted to back george bush .
troops from colchester were sent to iraq .
not all of them came back .
we are still suffering the consequences . ''

documents.title: iraq war : two sides 13 years on
text: as sir john chilcot concludes the invasion of iraq in 2003 was `` not a last resort '' , two essex mps who disagreed on the war give their views .
north essex mp bernard jenkin , voted for the war .
he said : `` it is far too soon to draw a judgement from this report .
i have not read it yet . ''
he said he hoped in the future intelligence would never be used as propaganda by governments and that there would be better post-conflict planning .
`` we really should have seen it through , '' he said .
`` we have contributed to the chaos . ''

documents.title: ron king trial : care worker reported comment
text: a care worker who heard ron king claim his wife would not be at a care home in two days time took it to mean he would be taking her home .
earlier the jury heard of a brief altercation between mr king and danielle cross in which mr king said : `` rita wo n't be here by monday anyway . ''
ms cross told the jury his comment was reported to a senior member of staff , but she took it to mean he planned to remove her from the de la mer care home in walton-on-the-naze .
the trial continues .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: ron king trial : 'rita wo n't be here by monday '
text: a disabled pensioner accused of murdering his wife in a care home told a care worker she would not be alive for long , a jury has been told .
rita king , 81 , died at de la mer house in walton-on-the-naze , essex , on 28 december last year .
her husband ronald , 87 , is on trial at chelmsford crown court for her murder .
care worker danielle cross described to the court an altercation she had with mr king two days before the death of his wife .
while she was making dinner for residents at the de la mer care home mr king said mrs king needed the toilet .
it was boxing day - a saturday .
he was rude , she told the jury , and said : `` i can never find a carer when i need one . ''
mr king then added : `` rita wo n't be here by monday anyway '' , she said .
we 'll have more from the trial throughout the day .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Essex

documents.title: rita king killing trial resumes
text: the trial of a disabled pensioner accused of murdering his wife at a care home has resumed this morning .
rita king , 81 , died at de la mer house in walton-on-the-naze , essex , on 28 december last year .
her husband ronald , 87 , is on trial at chelmsford crown court .
he denies murder .
the case continues .

documents.title: toddler in basildon light fall near miss
text: a basildon mother has told how a ceiling light collapsed next to her toddler son in his pushchair .
as first reported in the echo kim heckman was walking towards a shoe shop in basildon bus station when one of the ceiling lights fell to the ground .
`` it just happened so quick , '' she told bbc essex earlier .
`` i did n't actually see the light coming down , i heard a big smash and then i was in shock .
it was right where people queue for buses .
it could have been a lot worse . ''
her son ronny was unharmed .

documents.title: nurse cautioned over shop thefts
text: a nurse at princess alexandra hospital in harlow has been handed a two-year caution after she admitted three acts of shoplifting .
giovanna banjac was given three police cautions in december after making off with about £ 150 worth of goods .

a nursing and midwifery conduct panel heard the `` extremely remorseful and ashamed '' mrs banjac had referred herself to the panel and said i took items from three shops and i put them in my bag without paying .
`` i do n't know why i did what i did , that was not my intention when i left home that day , '' she told the panel .
in giving her a two year caution , the panel found mrs banjac `` has demonstrated real insight into the impact that her actions have had '' .

documents.title: man dies following basildon collision
text: essex police have tweeted that a man has died following a collision yesterday evening in basildon .

police were called to southernhay after an 84-year-old pedestrian from westcliff was collided with a nissan primera near the gala bingo hall.he suffered multiple injuries and was airlifted to the royal london hospital , where he died .
a man has died following a road traffic collision in southernhay # basildon at 6.05pm july 5 .
witnesses to the crash are asked to call 101 .
hello , i gave my details to a police officer yesterday regarding the accident , do i have to call 101 ?
so sad
author: Sonia Watson
BBC Essex

documents.title: weather : fine and dry
text: watch on for some good weather news
for the detailed forecast where you live visit bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: essex mp wants to know 'what number 10 knew '
text: basildon and billericay mp john barron , who quit his post as a shadow health minister over the iraq war , says he hopes the chilcot report will reveal what the government knew before the conflict .
the former soldier said : `` my view is that war should always be the measure of last resort .
`` i believe we went to war on a false premise .
i want to know whether number 10 intentionally deceive us . ''
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: father of fallen soldier 's chilcot hope
text: the father of a colchester-based soldier killed in iraq in 2003 says he hopes the war will rest on the consciences of politicians for the `` rest of their lives '' .
mike aston 's son cpl russell aston , 30 , was one of six royal military police officers killed when a 400-strong group of iraqis attacked a police station in majar al-kabir in june 2003 .

speaking ahead of the chilcot report 's publication later , mr aston said : `` there are people on the political side who , quite frankly , should have it on their consciences for the rest of their lives , like tony blair and jack straw , who said in the house of commons two days after my son was killed that they would not rest until they had brought the killers to justice .
`` it still has not happened . ''

documents.title: a warm wednesday welcome
text: good morning and welcome to the local live page for essex .
as well as covering breaking news from around the county , we will be :
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News
